warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles forward for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Rotate shoulders forward in a circular motion for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Clasp hands behind back and gently straighten arms, feeling a stretch in the chest. Hold for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Extend one arm overhead, bending the elbow.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Gently pull the elbow toward the head with the other hand, feeling a stretch in the triceps. Hold for 30 seconds per arm.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet together, arms at sides.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Jump, spreading legs and raising arms overhead. Return to starting position. Repeat for 1 minute.
Perform light cardio such as jogging in place for 1 minute to increase heart rate and blood flow.

exercises.setup: Adjust the machine seat so that your back is firmly supported and your shoulders are slightly below the handles.  Grab the handles with a slightly wider than shoulder-width grip, ensuring your elbows are slightly bent at the starting position.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit comfortably in the machine with your back firmly against the backrest. Grab the handles with a slightly wider than shoulder-width grip, ensuring your elbows are slightly bent.
2. Lower the Handles: Slowly lower the handles towards your chest, keeping your elbows slightly bent and maintaining a controlled movement. Focus on feeling a deep stretch in your chest muscles.

3. Press the Handles: Once you feel a deep stretch, forcefully press the handles back to the starting position, extending your arms fully but not locking your elbows. Maintain tension in your chest muscles throughout the movement.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and controlled movements.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form, but leaves you feeling challenged. Increase weight progressively each session.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width, ensuring your hands are evenly spaced.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width, ensuring your hands are evenly spaced. Your elbows should be slightly bent.
2. Lower the Barbell: Slowly lower the barbell towards your chest, keeping your elbows slightly bent and maintaining a controlled movement. The barbell should touch your chest.

3. Press the Barbell: Once the barbell touches your chest, forcefully press it back to the starting position, extending your arms fully but not locking your elbows. Maintain tension in your chest muscles throughout the movement.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and controlled movements.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form, ensuring the bar touches your chest. Increase weight progressively each session.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement and avoid bouncing the weight. Maintain a stable position to enhance mind-muscle connection.

exercises.setup: Adjust the bench to an incline of approximately 30-45 degrees. Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, ensuring your palms are facing each other.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the incline bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, ensuring your palms are facing each other. Your elbows should be slightly bent.
2. Lower the Dumbbells: Slowly lower the dumbbells towards your chest, keeping your elbows slightly bent and maintaining a controlled movement. The dumbbells should touch your upper chest.

3. Press the Dumbbells: Once the dumbbells touch your chest, forcefully press them back to the starting position, extending your arms fully but not locking your elbows. Maintain tension in your chest muscles throughout the movement.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and controlled movements.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. Increase weight progressively each session.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Adjust the bench to an incline of approximately 30-45 degrees. Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width, ensuring your hands are evenly spaced.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the incline bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width, ensuring your hands are evenly spaced. Your elbows should be slightly bent.
2. Lower the Barbell: Slowly lower the barbell towards your chest, keeping your elbows slightly bent and maintaining a controlled movement. The barbell should touch your upper chest.

3. Press the Barbell: Once the barbell touches your chest, forcefully press it back to the starting position, extending your arms fully but not locking your elbows. Maintain tension in your chest muscles throughout the movement.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and controlled movements.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. Increase weight progressively each session.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement and avoid bouncing the weight. Maintain a stable position to enhance mind-muscle connection.

exercises.setup: Adjust the cable machine to a height that allows you to sit comfortably with your arms extended slightly forward.  Grab the handles with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).
execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit comfortably on the machine with your back straight and your feet flat on the floor. Grab the handles with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).
2. Extend Your Arms: Extend your arms forward, keeping a slight bend in your elbows. This is your starting position.
3. Bring Handles Together: Slowly bring the handles together in front of you, squeezing your chest muscles at the end of the movement. Focus on feeling a contraction in your chest.
4. Return to Starting Position: Slowly return to the starting position, feeling a stretch in your chest muscles. Maintain control throughout the movement.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and controlled movements.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 12 reps with good form, focusing on the stretch and contraction. Increase weight progressively each session.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, ensuring your palms are facing each other.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, ensuring your palms are facing each other. Your arms should be extended slightly above your chest.
2. Lower the Dumbbells: Slowly lower the dumbbells to the sides, keeping a slight bend in your elbows. Focus on feeling a stretch in your chest muscles.
3. Bring Dumbbells Together: Slowly bring the dumbbells together above your chest, squeezing your chest muscles at the end of the movement. Focus on feeling a contraction in your chest.
4. Return to Starting Position: Slowly return to the starting position, feeling a stretch in your chest muscles. Maintain control throughout the movement.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and controlled movements.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 12 reps with good form, focusing on the stretch and contraction. Increase weight progressively each session.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement and avoid bouncing the weight. Maintain a stable position to enhance mind-muscle connection.

exercises.setup: Choose your preferred overhead press variation (barbell, dumbbell, or machine). Ensure a stable base and proper form.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the weight at shoulder height. Maintain a straight back and engaged core.
2. Press Upward: Press the weight overhead until your arms are fully extended, but avoid locking your elbows. Focus on controlled movement.
3. Lower Slowly: Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position, maintaining control and tension in your shoulder muscles.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and controlled movements.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. Increase weight progressively each session.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a stable base and avoid swinging the weight. Focus on controlled movements to prevent injury.

exercises.setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with a narrow grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width, ensuring your hands are evenly spaced.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with a narrow grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width, ensuring your hands are evenly spaced. Your elbows should be slightly bent.
2. Lower the Barbell: Slowly lower the barbell towards your chest, keeping your elbows slightly bent and maintaining a controlled movement. The barbell should touch your chest.

3. Press the Barbell: Once the barbell touches your chest, forcefully press it back to the starting position, extending your arms fully but not locking your elbows. Maintain tension in your triceps muscles throughout the movement.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and controlled movements.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. Increase weight progressively each session.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Attach a straight bar to the cable machine's low pulley. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the straight bar with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width.
2. Extend Your Arms: Extend your arms fully, keeping your elbows close to your sides. This is your starting position.
3. Lower the Bar: Slowly lower the bar towards your thighs, keeping your elbows close to your sides. Focus on feeling a stretch in your triceps.
4. Return to Starting Position: Slowly return to the starting position, extending your arms fully. Maintain control throughout the movement.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and controlled movements.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. Increase weight progressively each session.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement and avoid bouncing the weight. Maintain a stable position to enhance mind-muscle connection.

exercises.setup: Position the cable at a low setting and use a bar attachment. Stand facing away from the cable machine with arms overhead.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand facing away from the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the bar attachment with an overhand grip, ensuring your arms are fully extended overhead.
2. Lower the Bar: Slowly lower the bar behind your head by bending your elbows. Focus on feeling a stretch in your triceps.
3. Extend Your Arms: Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position, focusing on contracting your triceps muscles.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and controlled movements.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 12 reps with good form, focusing on the stretch and contraction. Increase weight progressively each session.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a EZ-bar with an overhand grip, ensuring your hands are slightly wider than shoulder-width.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold the EZ-bar with an overhand grip, ensuring your hands are slightly wider than shoulder-width. Your elbows should be slightly bent.
2. Lower the Barbell: Slowly lower the barbell towards your forehead, keeping your elbows close to your head and maintaining a controlled movement. The barbell should arc behind your head.
3. Extend Your Arms: Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position, focusing on contracting your triceps muscles.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and controlled movements.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 12 reps with good form, focusing on the stretch and contraction. Increase weight progressively each session.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement and avoid bouncing the weight. Maintain a stable position to enhance mind-muscle connection.
